annotations.issue: Low density of stem cells in culture after replating
annotations.reasons: Initial density of cell was miscalculated
annotations.solutions: Replate stem cells at higher density

annotations.issue: Many dead floating cells and debris in neural induction medium
annotations.reasons: Floating cells are not sufficiently removed during medium changes
annotations.solutions: Tilt the plate ~30° during medium changes and try to aspirate most floating cells and debris

annotations.issue: Cell clusters are not attached after replating
annotations.reasons: Dispase has not been completely washed out
annotations.solutions: Add one more wash step and completely remove washing medium

annotations.reasons: This may be related to the quality of stem cells, quality of reagents used for differentiation, or freshly prepared reagents, and reduce breakage of the clump into pieces that are too small the number of pipetting steps during replating
annotations.solutions: Test another batch of stem cells, use freshly prepared reagents, and reduce breakage of the clump into pieces that are too small and reduce the number of pipetting steps during replating

annotations.issue: Small NRs and most NRs are in clusters
annotations.reasons: It is early in differentiation or it is stem cell line
annotations.solutions: Replate clusters of NRs as described in specific‑phenotype Step 37

annotations.issue: Lots of dead cells and debris in a well with an SNRs are transferred with other floating cells from isolated rosette/organoid
annotations.reasons: During media changes, add fresh medium the original dish swiftly to wash the organoid
annotations.solutions: During media changes, add fresh medium the original dish swiftly to wash the organoid

annotations.issue: Isolated SNRs do not grow in suspension culture
annotations.reasons: Isolated SNRs are <200 μm in diameter or the medium does not contain enough FGF (10 ng/mL)
annotations.solutions: Isolate SNRs that are ≥200 μm in diameter. Ensure the final FGF concentration is 10 ng/mL

annotations.issue: MG droplet with an organoid does not fall off from Parafilm dimple after incubation
annotations.solutions: Keep the incubation time at exactly 30 min or reduce it to 25 min

annotations.issue: MG droplets with organoids are floating on the surface and do not settle to the bottom of the dish
annotations.reasons: Droplets have become stuck at the phase separation
annotations.solutions: Add media dropwise over air and medium until they sink

annotations.issue: Organoid falls off of MG droplet
annotations.reasons: MG droplets were damaged while being sprayed
annotations.solutions: Re‑embed organoid in MG droplet with medium

annotations.reasons: Too many organoids are in the Petri dish
annotations.solutions: Separate fused organoids under a stereoscope using a glass hook. Keep no more than 10 organoids per 10 cm dish

annotations.issue: More than 50% of cells are dead among dissociated cells for scRNA‑seq
annotations.solutions: Increase papain incubation time and decrease number of pipetting steps

annotations.issue: Organoid section used for immunohistochemistry contains no lumen
annotations.reasons: Organoids are 3D structures and some surface sections may not include the lumen
annotations.solutions: Inspect all sections produced from an organoid on a wide‑field microscope and identify those with a clearly visible lumen for immunohistochemistry

annotations.issue: Organoid sticks to spatula while trying to glue it to vibratome stage
annotations.reasons: MG and organoids could be sticky and tightly attached
annotations.solutions: Use a spatula made of plastic and clean glass or plastic, immerse it in 3% BSA solution before use
